page.title: 13The Wolsingham Library
page.content: The Librarian Speaks:"Two of us work in the{Library}which is open on Saturday morning and four afternoons. It is the only library in the town but there is a{travelling library}which goes around the farms every fortnight.Anyone can join and younger children can get books on their parent's tickets.There is a junior section.The most popular books are romances and westerns.You can also join our{Audio Library}and borrow tapes and records;the subscription is Â£2.50 and a charge of 25p per record is made.Records and tapes,like books, can be borrowed for three weeks. Our{daily work}involves issuing books,shelving,sending out overdue notices or book orders,routine paper work and putting up displays.We also answer people's queries and supply information."
